page.title: 02Hartington Church
page.content: {Hartington church}dates back from the early 13th century.The church is dedicated to St Giles it is built up on a hill and it looks over most of the village.There are many interesting features we can see local stones,sandstone from Staffordshire and the white limestone from Derbyshire.Inside the church are a number of medievel relics.a long stone coffin was found underneath the floor of the nave.On it was a figure of a woman holding a heart between her hands.In the grave yard there is one anceint tomb and you can see the bones though cracks under the lid.In the tower are three bells from the 17th century.The oldest bell still chimes every hour.the church has got a flower group and a bible reading group.It always looks welcoming and sparkling clean.
